intro: Senecio schweinitzianus, commonly known as the Schweinitz's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, with a rough texture, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas.
